channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AL
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AL

item.title: Report X-2023061682
item.description:
Report X-2023061682

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-26
  • City: MADISON
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND ON ITS SIDE AND HAD ALREADY SPILLED. THE PACKAGE WAS IN A BLACK BIN ALREADY WHEN FOUND. THE SPILLAGE ON THE HAZMAT WAS MINIMAL. THE PACKAGE WAS TAKEN STRAIGHT TO THE QA CAGE WHEN FOUND. DescribePack: THE PACKAGE HAD LOOSE CAPS WHICH CAUSED THE HAZMAT TO SPILL A LITTLE BIT DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: THE PACKAGE WAS TAKEN STRAIGHT TO THE QA CAGE WHEN FOUND. THE PACKAGE WAS ALSO PUT IN A BLACK BIN TO CONTAIN IT.

item.title: Report X-2023061681
item.description:
Report X-2023061681

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-25
  • City: EASTABOGA
  • State: AL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was found to be leaking and was put in a tote for the Hazmat team. When hazmat team inspected the package it was found that the cap had came loose and the contents were leaking from it DescribePack: The cap came loose on one of the bottles DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The box was put into a tote
